result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel R. Fleming was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: State files an Amended Information, charging DEF with 5th offense OWI.  DEF pleads No Contest. Found Guilty.  Sentence is withheld, DEF placed on 3 years probation, with conditional jail time of 210 days, credit for one day time served. Report to jail immediately.   Fine $2500.  DL revoked 33 months plus 210 days.  IID   On any vehicle owned or operated 33 months.  Forward $1000 Bond to DOC for payment obligations.

DL revoked 33 months plus 210 days.  
 DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.
IID  On any vehicle owned or operated.

miscConds.notes: $2500 fine.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.

AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations  Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.  

Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent

Absolute Sobriety.  May not be on premises that serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.    1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
